alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Central; Baldwin Coastal; Baldwin Inland; Butler; Choctaw; Clarke; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Mobile Central; Mobile Coastal; Mobile Inland; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 5:09AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A BRIEF WINTRY MIX OF LIGHT RAIN AND LIGHT SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS SOUTHEAST MISSISSIPPI AND INTERIOR SOUTHWEST ALABAMA EARLY THIS MORNING... ...MUCH DRIER AIR AND INCREASED NORTHERLY WINDS WILL BRING AN ELEVATED FIRE DANGER TO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON... A much colder airmass is moving into southeast Mississippi and interior southwest Alabama early this morning, with temperatures falling into the mid to upper 30s. An approaching upper level system will bring an area of light precipitation to much of southeast Mississippi and southwest Alabama through around 9 AM CST this morning. Temperatures may be cold enough for light rain to briefly mix with or change to light snow flurries across locations generally along and northwest of the Interstate 65 corridor early this morning. The wintry mix potential will be very brief and no accumulations or impacts are anticipated. A much drier airmass will spread across the region in the wake of the passing system this morning. Very low afternoon relative humidity values in combination with increased northerly winds will lead to elevated fire danger across the area this afternoon. Exercise extreme caution if using flammable materials outdoors today.
